column4: Does anybody now anything about setting up USB printer on laptop. Im having a bit of a nightmare.
Nope a canon, with good documentation but it wont work.

the problem is Im using a docking station, and laptop seems to be some sort of coms problem somewhere. Ive installed driver followed all ins, it finds it on lsusb but wont print the test page goes into the balck holw.
bizarre... is there a working print monitor/manager software that installed w/ the driver?
nope it says use the admin print configuration tool to setup printer.
if you do print-admin list or whatever the equivalent is, does the job show up?
yes and the little printer top right and it is there printer stopped, or it is there and goes but doesn't print.
sorry, man... drivers definitely are not my thing.
thanks anyway Im going to go and throw the laptop of a cliff.
hahaha, i wouldn't endorse wanton destruction JUST yet.  i'm sure someone will be able to help you
have you tried "sudo apt-get install lib-fix-everything"?  XD
nope is that the exact syntax ?.
i was joking.  ;P  I WISH there was such a package
I guessed but hey I can write a script like that but not sure what it would do.
it would probably just ask the user what the problem is, then go to #ubuntu and ask about it
